intro: Oenothera hookeri subsp. grisea, commonly known as graystem evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its grayish-green foliage and showy yellow flowers that open in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is known for its unique flowering behavior. Its scientific name reflects its taxonomic classification and subspecific distinction within the Oenothera genus.
